title: (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Courts of Justice
heading: (1) This Order may be cited as the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal
text_raw:
1. 

(1) This Order may be cited as the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal 

and High Court (Fees) (Amendment) Order 2021. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 1 March 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited supreme court court appeal high court (fees) (amendment) order 2021 (2) order come operation 1 march 2021

title: (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Courts of Justice
heading: 2. The Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and High Court (Fees) Order
text_raw:
2. The Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and High Court (Fees) Order 
2014 (S.I. No. 492 of 2014) is amended in Schedule 1 by the substitution of the 
following for Part 8: 

“PART 8 

FEES PAYABLE IN THE PROBATE OFFICE AND DISTRICT 

PROBATE REGISTRIES 

Item 

(1) 

Fee 

(2) 

1 

2 

For every application for an order of a 
Probate Officer, Assistant Probate 
Officer or District Probate Registrar 

€50.00 

For every certificate signed by a judge 
as to the authority of any person to act 
in a specified capacity or for any 
similar certificate 

€30.00 

3 On the submission to the Probate 

Office or the District Probate Registry 
of an application for a primary grant 
of representation - 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th February, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [80] 3 

(a) 

where the net value of the 
estate does not exceed 

€100,000 

€250,000 

€500,000 

€750,000 

€1,000,000 

€100.00 

€200.00 

€350.00 

€500.00 

€650.00 

(b) 

where the net value of the 
estate exceeds €1,000,000 - 

(i) 

for the first €1,000,000 

€650.00 

and 

€400.00 

(ii) 

for every €500,000, or 
fraction thereof by 
which the value 
exceeds €1,000,000, a 
further fee of 

4 

For every double, cessate, 
unadministered or duplicate grant of 
representation 

€150.00 

5 Where any grant is sought by personal 

application 

The total fee payable shall 
be double the appropriate 
amount that would be 
chargeable under the item at 
reference number 3 or 4 of 
column (1), as applicable, 
were the grant not sought by 
personal application 

6 

For lodging or re-entering any motion 
paper, whether ex-parte or on notice 

€100.00 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [80] 

7 On lodgement of a corrective 

affidavit. 

The correct fee under the 
item at reference number 3 
or 5 of column (1) as 
appropriate less the amount 
of the fee previously 
charged subject to a 
minimum fee of €50.00 

8 

9 

10 

11 

12 

13 

14 

€100.00 

€30.00 

€20.00 

€120.00 

For the entry of any caveat 

For filing any warning, citation or 
subpoena or any appearance to any 
warning, citation or subpoena 

For every search made by an Officer 
of the Probate Office or of a District 
Probate Registry for which the officer 
is requested to search for a will or 
codicil or for any record of a grant or 
any other document filed in the 
Probate Office or in a District Probate 
Registry, including the inspection of 
any original will or codicil or any 
record of a grant 

For all searches made on any one day 
by the representative of a newspaper 
or group of newspapers (the 
representative must state on the search 
docket his or her name and that of the 
newspaper or group of newspapers 
which he or she represents) 

For any official copy of any will, 
grant or other document (other than 
an inland revenue affidavit) 

€15.00 

For a sealed and certified copy will or 
grant 

€20.00 

For a sealed and certified copy will 
and grant bespoken at the time of 
lodgement of the application for grant 
of representation 

€25.00 

15 

For an attested copy of an inland 
revenue affidavit 

€25.00 

”. 

 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Order. 

[80] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 

23 February, 2021. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 February, 2021. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [80]

title: (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Courts of Justice
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and High Court (Fees) 
Order 2014 (S.I. No. 492 of 2014) in respect of fees payable in the Probate 
Office and District Probate Registries. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [80] 7
